lead_paragraph: SIEGEL--Jerome. Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City deeply mourns the death of esteemed trustee and Vice President of the Board of Directors, Mr. Jerome A. Siegel. Mr. Siegel, who along with his late wife, Ruth, was a longtime friend and a passionate supporter of the mentoring movement. Since joining the Board in 1993, Mr. Siegel fought to empower the children of New York City by helping provide them with a mentor and access to academic support services. A true advocate for the underserved, Mr. Siegel was committed to making a difference in their lives. A friend to many of the trustees and staff at Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City, Mr. Siegel will be fondly remembered for his firm but gentle spirit and his eagerness to take the time and share his inspiring life story to many of the youth in the Big Brothers Big Sisters of New York City program. Mr. Siegel is survived by his children and grandchildren, and we extend our condolences to each of them. We hope they can find some comfort in knowing that the impact that Mr. Siegel has made in communities across our City will forever remain. 1/3
